gov.usgs.anss.net

Class UdpTunnelListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.net.UdpTunnelListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class UdpTunnelListener
extends java.lang.Thread
    This creates a Udp Socket end and runs a thread reading from that socket. Any input received is forwarded via the UdpTunnel registered on creation. There is also a public write() for sending Udp packets out of this socket end.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      Creates a new instance of UdpTunnelListener which listens to a local port of Udp traffic from a given IP address and port, and the forwards any such data to an RTS using a UdpTunnel object to a given target port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UdpTunnelListener

        public UdpTunnelListener(java.lang.String tg,
                         int localPortIn,
                         java.lang.String remIP,
                         int remport,
                         UdpTunnel u)
                  throws java.net.SocketException,
                         java.net.UnknownHostException
        Creates a new instance of UdpTunnelListener which listens to a local port of Udp traffic from a given IP address and port, and the forwards any such data to an RTS using a UdpTunnel object to a given target port.
        Parameters:
        tg - a short string describing this port (often a station name)
        localPortIn - The Port on this computer to listen for UDP traffic destine for RTS
        remIP - String representing IP address of the IP address to be forwarded to
        remport - The port any Udp data should be forwarded too (out of far end of tunnel)
        u - The UdpTunnel which this listener should use to send data
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - If some error occurs while opening this socket end (often bind errs)
        java.net.UnknownHostException - The remote IP address could not be translated.

      • getLocalPort

        public int getLocalPort()
        get the local port that this UdpListener is accepting data from

        public boolean isRunning()
        return isRunning variable (should track Thread.isAlive()
        Returns:
        if true, run() is still operating and loop is not terminated.

        public void setTerminate(boolean t)
        set the terminate flag. This will cause the thread run() loop to exit and socket to close
        Parameters:
        t - IF true, cause it to shutdown

      • getBytesIn

        public long getBytesIn()
        return number of bytes into the UdpSocket since creation
        Returns:

      • getBytesOut

        public long getBytesOut()
        return number of bytes out of this UdpSocket end
        Returns:

      • write

        public void write(byte[] buf,
                  int len,
                  java.net.InetAddress addr,
                  int port)
        write a buffer of UDP data out of this UdpSocket. The buffer, length and target IP/Port
        Parameters:
        buf - The data buffer with raw bytes to write
        len - the length of the data to be writtem (should be less than buf.length
        addr - an InetAddress with the IP address of the target
        port - the port number on the target to direct this packet
